label: Journey Mapping & Visualization
description: Real-time journey analytics that auto-generate visual journey maps from behavioral data with automated friction point detection and weekly updates based on actual customer paths.

traditional.workflow: 1. Schedule quarterly journey mapping workshop with cross-functional teams. 2. Facilitate 2-day workshop with sticky notes and whiteboards. 3. Manually consolidate journey maps into PowerPoint/Visio diagrams. 4. Distribute static journey maps to stakeholders via email. 5. Maps become outdated within weeks as customer behavior changes.
constraints: Quarterly updates mean maps are stale 9 out of 12 months
Journey maps based on assumptions not actual behavioral data
Manual workshop process requires 40-60 hours of cross-functional time
No visibility into actual customer paths vs designed journeys
Friction points identified through anecdotal feedback not data
Static diagrams don't adapt to seasonal or market changes

agentic.workflow: 1. Journey Mapping Agent continuously analyzes clickstream, transaction, and cross-channel behavioral data. 2. Agent auto-generates journey maps showing actual customer paths (not just designed flows). 3. Behavioral Analytics Agent identifies drop-off points, delays, and friction with ML scoring. 4. Visualization Tool renders interactive journey maps with drill-down capability. 5. Agent auto-updates maps weekly based on evolving customer behavior patterns.
benefits: Weekly updates vs quarterly (50x faster refresh)
Data-driven journey maps vs assumption-based (90%+ accuracy)
Auto-discovery of actual paths vs designed-only journeys
95% reduction in manual effort (2-3 hours vs 40-60 hours)
Real-time friction detection enables rapid optimization
Interactive dashboards vs static PowerPoint diagrams

quickWins: Deploy journey analytics on top 3 customer journeys
Auto-generate weekly journey maps from existing analytics
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform or analytics warehouse

label: Touchpoint Experience Optimization
description: AI-powered scoring of every customer touchpoint with cross-channel optimization recommendations and continuous improvement cycles to maximize conversion.

traditional.workflow: 1. Product manager manually analyzes touchpoint performance in Google Analytics. 2. Identify top 3-5 problematic touchpoints based on bounce/exit rates. 3. Create optimization project backlog and prioritize based on intuition. 4. Design team creates mockups, engineering implements changes (3-6 months). 5. Measure impact post-launch with limited before/after comparison.
constraints: Siloed optimization by channel (web team doesn't coordinate with mobile team)
3-6 month improvement cycles from identification to deployment
Manual analysis limited to top 10-20 touchpoints (missing long-tail issues)
No cross-touchpoint optimization (e.g., optimizing checkout without considering cart)
Impact measurement relies on simple before/after (no control groups)
Prioritization based on gut feel not quantified opportunity

agentic.workflow: 1. Touchpoint Optimization Agent continuously scores all customer touchpoints using conversion, engagement, and satisfaction metrics. 2. Experience Scoring Agent identifies underperforming touchpoints with quantified impact (e.g., 'Fixing checkout step 2 could lift conversion 8%'). 3. Agent recommends specific improvements using A/B test results, heatmaps, and session replay insights. 4. Agent prioritizes optimizations by impact Ã— effort score. 5. Agent monitors post-optimization performance and triggers follow-up tests.
dataSources: Engagement metrics (time on page, scroll depth, clicks)
benefits: 15-30% conversion improvement at key touchpoints through data-driven optimization
Continuous optimization vs 3-6 month cycles
100% touchpoint coverage vs manual top 10-20
Cross-channel optimization ensures consistent experience
Quantified ROI for every optimization investment
Automatic prioritization by business impact

quickWins: Deploy heatmap analytics on top 10 pages

label: Next Best Action (NBA) Recommendations
description: ML-powered recommendations for the next best action per customer in real-time context with 8-15% engagement rates vs 2-5% for rule-based approaches.

traditional.workflow: 1. Marketing team creates rule-based triggers (e.g., 'If cart abandonment, send email in 24 hours'). 2. Same email sent to all cart abandoners regardless of context. 3. No consideration of customer preferences, channel, or timing. 4. Batch campaigns sent overnight (not real-time). 5. Generic offers not personalized to individual customers.
constraints: Rule-based triggers lack intelligence (same action for everyone)
2-5% engagement rate due to generic, non-personalized actions
Batch processing means 12-24 hour delays for time-sensitive actions
No cross-channel orchestration (customer gets duplicate messages)
No learning or optimization based on outcomes
Limited to 5-10 pre-defined scenarios (cart abandon, browse abandon, etc.)

agentic.workflow: 1. Next Best Action Agent continuously evaluates every customer's current state and context. 2. Context Analysis Agent assesses: recent behavior, purchase history, engagement patterns, predicted propensity scores. 3. Agent recommends optimal action from 50+ possibilities: product recommendations, offers, content, service actions. 4. Real-Time Decision Engine selects best channel (email, SMS, push, in-app) and timing. 5. Agent learns from outcomes: adjusts models based on engagement, conversion, satisfaction.
dataSources: Historical NBA outcome data for learning
benefits: 8-15% engagement rate vs 2-5% for rule-based (3-10 pt improvement)
Real-time decisioning vs 12-24 hour batch delays
1:1 personalized actions vs segment-level generic actions
50+ action types vs 5-10 pre-defined scenarios
Cross-channel orchestration prevents duplicate/conflicting messages
Continuous learning improves recommendations over time

quickWins: Deploy propensity models for top 3 actions (churn, upsell, engagement)
Implement real-time decisioning for cart abandonment
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform with real-time streaming

label: Journey Anomaly Detection & Recovery
description: Real-time detection of journey friction with proactive recovery offers to reduce churn at friction points by 50-70% through immediate intervention.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer encounters friction (checkout error, out of stock, payment failure). 2. Customer calls support or abandons journey (30-50% churn at friction points). 3. Support agent reacts to customer complaint after the fact. 4. Agent offers generic apology and discount if customer complains loudly. 5. No systematic tracking or prevention of friction patterns.
constraints: Reactive response only after customer contacts support (if they do)
30-50% churn rate when customers encounter friction
No proactive detection or intervention before customer abandons
Generic recovery offers not tailored to specific friction type
No learning to prevent similar friction in the future
Support agents overwhelmed with friction-related contacts

agentic.workflow: 1. Anomaly Detection Agent monitors customer journeys in real-time for friction signals: repeated page refreshes, error messages, extended time on step, rage clicks. 2. Agent classifies friction type and severity (payment error, out of stock, technical issue). 3. Recovery Orchestration Agent immediately triggers appropriate intervention: proactive chat offer, discount code, alternative product suggestion, expedited shipping. 4. Agent tracks recovery outcome and learns which interventions work for each friction type. 5. Insights routed to product teams to fix root causes.
dataSources: Historical friction and recovery outcome data
benefits: 50-70% reduction in churn at friction points through proactive intervention
Real-time detection vs reactive response after abandonment
10-20% friction churn vs 30-50% traditional
Tailored recovery offers maximize effectiveness (discount vs alternative product vs help)
Continuous learning improves friction prevention
30-40% reduction in support contacts due to proactive resolution

quickWins: Deploy error monitoring and proactive chat for checkout errors
Implement rage click detection with recovery offers

label: Cross-Channel Journey Continuity
description: Seamless handoff and context preservation across channels to reduce journey abandonment by 20-35% through unified cross-channel experiences.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer browses products on mobile app during commute. 2. Customer switches to desktop website at home to complete purchase. 3. Cart doesn't sync - customer must search for products again. 4. Customer's browsing history, preferences, and session state lost. 5. Customer frustrated by disjointed experience, abandons journey (25-40% abandonment on channel switch).
constraints: Siloed channel systems with no cross-channel state management
Cart doesn't sync across channels (web, mobile, in-store)
Customer must restart journey from scratch when switching channels
No context transfer (browsing history, preferences, intent)
25-40% journey abandonment when customers switch channels
Separate logins and authentication required per channel

agentic.workflow: 1. Journey Continuity Agent maintains unified customer session across all channels (web, mobile, in-store, voice). 2. Context Management Agent preserves: cart contents, browsing history, search queries, preferences, payment methods. 3. Agent detects channel switch (e.g., mobile to desktop) and seamlessly transfers state. 4. Identity Resolution links customer across devices and channels. 5. Customer continues journey exactly where they left off with full context.
dataSources: Customer identity graph (email, device IDs, cookies)
benefits: 20-35% reduction in journey abandonment through seamless transitions
100% context preservation vs 0% (cart, history, preferences sync instantly)
Unified authentication across channels (single sign-on)
Real-time cart sync across web, mobile, in-store
Customers can start journey on any channel and finish on another
Consistent personalized experience across all touchpoints

quickWins: Implement real-time cart sync between web and mobile
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform with cross-channel profiles
Unified commerce platform or API integration

label: Persona-Based Journey Customization
description: Adaptive journeys tailored to customer personas with behavioral segmentation delivering 25-45% engagement improvement through relevant experiences.

traditional.workflow: 1. Design single generic journey for all customers (one-size-fits-all). 2. All customers see same navigation, content, product recommendations. 3. No personalization based on customer type, preferences, or behavior. 4. High-value customers get same experience as first-time browsers. 5. Frequent shoppers see same onboarding flow as new customers.
constraints: Generic journeys don't resonate with diverse customer segments
No differentiation by customer value (VIP vs new customer treated same)
One-size-fits-all approach leads to poor engagement (15-30% engagement)
High-intent customers forced through unnecessary steps
New customers overwhelmed by features designed for power users
No journey adaptation based on customer learning

agentic.workflow: 1. Persona Analysis Agent segments customers using behavioral data: purchase frequency, browsing patterns, engagement level, price sensitivity. 2. Journey Customization Agent creates persona-specific journey variants: VIP fast-track, new customer onboarding, deal seeker, research-heavy buyer. 3. Agent adapts journey in real-time based on signals: first-time visitor gets guided tour, frequent buyer gets quick reorder. 4. Content Personalization tailors messaging, product placement, and offers per persona. 5. Agent learns and refines persona definitions based on journey performance.
dataSources: Customer behavioral data (purchase history, browse patterns)
Customer value and lifetime value data
benefits: 25-45% engagement improvement through relevant experiences
5-10 persona-specific journey variants vs 1 generic journey
VIP customers get fast-track experiences (3 steps vs 8 steps)
New customers get onboarding and education
Deal seekers prioritize promotions, research-heavy get comparisons
Continuous persona refinement based on journey performance

quickWins: Create VIP fast-track journey for top 10% customers
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform with behavioral segmentation
A/B testing platform for journey variants

label: Journey Performance Analytics & Attribution
description: Multi-touch attribution at journey level with real-time ROI dashboards enabling data-driven journey investment decisions and accurate performance measurement.

traditional.workflow: 1. Marketing analyst runs monthly report on journey performance in Google Analytics. 2. Attribution limited to last-touch (credit goes to final touchpoint before conversion). 3. No visibility into multi-touch journey contribution. 4. Journey ROI unclear - can't quantify investment impact. 5. Report created in spreadsheet, shared via email, used for retrospective analysis only.
constraints: Last-touch attribution ignores 80% of customer journey (all touchpoints before last)
Monthly reporting means decisions made on stale data
No journey-level ROI measurement (only channel-level)
Can't quantify value of journey improvements
Spreadsheet-based analysis limited to basic metrics
No real-time visibility into journey performance

agentic.workflow: 1. Journey Analytics Agent tracks customer through entire multi-touch journey across channels. 2. Attribution Modeling Agent applies advanced models: position-based, time-decay, algorithmic attribution. 3. Agent calculates journey-level metrics: conversion rate, time to convert, touchpoint contribution, drop-off analysis. 4. Agent quantifies ROI of journey improvements: 'Checkout optimization increased revenue $2.5M/year'. 5. Real-time dashboards show journey performance, attribution, and ROI for immediate decision-making.
dataSources: Complete customer journey paths across touchpoints
Conversion and revenue data by journey
benefits: Multi-touch attribution reveals true touchpoint value vs last-touch bias
Real-time dashboards vs monthly retrospective reports
Journey-level ROI quantification enables data-driven investments
Accurate attribution improves marketing budget allocation
Identifies high-value journey paths for optimization priority
Business case for journey improvements backed by ROI data

quickWins: Implement position-based attribution for top 3 journeys
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform with journey tracking
